meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the common people.
meanings.sent1: The folkish celebration brought together people from all walks of life.
meanings.sent2: She wore a folkish dress made of simple, homemade fabric.
meanings.sent3: The folkish dance at the party had everyone laughing and joining in.
meanings.sent4: The folkish atmosphere of the market made it feel like a cozy village square.
meanings.sent5: The folkish traditions were passed down through generations, connecting families.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or characteristics of traditional folk music.
meanings.sent1: The folkish melody played on the guitar was soothing and familiar.
meanings.sent2: Her voice had a folkish tone that reminded everyone of simpler times.
meanings.sent3: The folkish lyrics of the song told a story of love and loss.
meanings.sent4: The folkish instruments created a nostalgic ambiance in the room.
meanings.sent5: The folkish tunes resonated with the audience, evoking memories of the past.

meanings.definition: In a manner typical of a particular group or community.
meanings.sent1: She spoke folkishly, using phrases only her close friends understood.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors greeted each other folkishly, with a wave and a smile.
meanings.sent3: The children played folkishly, inventing their own games in the park.
meanings.sent4: The group danced folkishly around the bonfire, lost in their own world.
meanings.sent5: The team worked folkishly to complete the project ahead of schedule.
